# Funding, Publicity & Patent Financing Guide

## For: MOA Telehealth Governor / TeleTrust Guard

**Last Updated:** 2025-12-16

---

## 1. Non-Dilutive Funding (Grants)

### 1.1 SBIR/STTR — "America's Seed Fund"

**Best Fit for Your Product:**

| Program | Focus | Phase I Amount | Timeline |
|---------|-------|----------------|----------|
| **NSF SBIR - Digital Health** | AI in healthcare, clinical decision support | $275K | 6-12 months |
| **NIH SBIR - NIDA** | AI for healthcare compliance | Up to $307K | 6 months |
| **NSF SBIR - AI** | Trustworthy, safe AI systems | $275K | 6-12 months |

**Why You Qualify:**

- Small business (< 500 employees) ✅
- US-based ✅
- Novel AI technology for healthcare ✅
- Deterministic safety layer = "Trustworthy AI" ✅

**Action Items:**

1. Register at SAM.gov (required for all federal grants)
2. Create NSF account at research.gov
3. Apply to NSF Topic H6: Digital Health OR Topic I1: AI
4. Deadline: Rolling (check current cycle)

**Application Tips:**

- Emphasize "fail-closed" architecture as safety innovation
- Cite your +17.5% retention advantage benchmark
- Position as "deterministic governance for probabilistic AI"

---

### 1.2 Healthcare-Focused Accelerators

| Accelerator | Investment | Equity | Focus |
|-------------|------------|--------|-------|
| **Y Combinator** | $500K | 7% | General / AI |
| **Techstars AI Health Baltimore** | $120K | 6% | AI + Healthcare |
| **Cedars-Sinai Accelerator** | $100K note | Convertible | Clinical AI |
| **500 Global** | $150K | 6% | Seed stage |
| **Startup Health** | Stipend | Equity | Digital health |

**Best Fit:** Techstars AI Health Baltimore or Cedars-Sinai

- Both focus on clinical AI solutions
- Mentorship + network in healthcare

## 2. Dilutive Funding (Venture Capital)

### 2.1 Healthcare AI VCs (2025 Active)

| Firm | Stage | Focus | Notable |
|------|-------|-------|---------|
| **General Catalyst** | Seed-A | Health tech | $10B+ fund |
| **Andreessen Horowitz (a16z Bio)** | Seed-B | AI + Health | Leading rounds |
| **GV (Google Ventures)** | Seed-A | DeepTech | Strategic for Google exit |
| **Khosla Ventures** | Seed | Bold bets | Likes technical moats |
| **Rock Health** | Seed | Digital health | Industry focused |
| **7wireVentures** | Seed-A | Healthcare consumers | Telehealth aligned |

### 2.2 What VCs Want to See

| Requirement | Your Status |
|-------------|-------------|
| Working product | ✅ Live API |
| Technical moat | ✅ Rhythm Engine IP |
| Market timing | ✅ Post-Wiz acquisition wave |
| Team | ⚠️ Solo founder (weakness) |
| Revenue | ⚠️ $0 (need pilots) |

**Recommendation:** Get 2-3 paying pilots FIRST, then approach VCs. They want proof of demand.

---

## 3. Patent Financing

### 3.1 Convert Provisional to Utility

**Current Status:** Provisional Patent #63/926,578
**Deadline:** 12 months from filing date

**Cost Estimates:**

| Item | Cost Range |
|------|------------|
| USPTO Filing Fees | $320 (micro entity) |
| Patent Attorney | $8,000 - $15,000 |
| Patent Prosecution | $3,000 - $8,000 |
| **Total** | **$11,000 - $25,000** |

### 3.2 Patent Financing Options

| Option | Structure | Pros | Cons |
|--------|-----------|------|------|
| **SBIR Phase I** | Grant | Non-dilutive | 6+ month process |
| **Patent Loans** | Debt | Quick, keep equity | Interest, personal guarantee |
| **Revenue** | Self-funded | Full ownership | Need customers first |
| **IP-backed financing** | Asset sale | Cash now | Lose control |

**Recommendation:** Use SBIR Phase I (~$275K) to fund patent + 6 months runway.

---

## 4. Publicity & Credibility

### 4.1 Press Strategy

| Outlet | Approach | Value |
|--------|----------|-------|
| **TechCrunch** | Pitch to Health reporter | VC visibility |
| **Fierce Healthcare** | Submit press release | Industry credibility |
| **VentureBeat AI** | Technical deep-dive | AI community |
| **LinkedIn** | Personal posts | Direct reach |
| **Hacker News** | Show HN post | Developer credibility |

**Story Angles:**

1. "The Math That Makes AI Safe for Doctors"
2. "Why Google's $32B Wiz Buy Signals the Next Wave"
3. "Fail-Closed AI: Healthcare's Missing Safety Layer"

### 4.2 Credibility Builders

| Action | Impact | Effort |
|--------|--------|--------|
| Google Cloud Marketplace listing | High (visibility to enterprise) | Medium |
| Publish whitepaper on arXiv | Medium (academic credibility) | Low |
| Speak at HIMSS/HLTH | High (industry reach) | High |
| Case study with 1 pilot | Very High (proof) | Medium |

---

## 5. Recommended 90-Day Roadmap

### Month 1: Foundation

| Week | Action |
|------|--------|
| 1 | Apply to Techstars AI Health Baltimore |
| 1 | Register on SAM.gov |
| 2 | LinkedIn outreach: 20 compliance officers |
| 3 | Get 1 pilot (even free) |
| 4 | Record 3-min demo video |

### Month 2: Traction

| Week | Action |
|------|--------|
| 5 | Submit NSF SBIR pre-application |
| 6 | Case study from pilot #1 |
| 7 | Get pilot #2-3 |
| 8 | Google Cloud Marketplace submission |

### Month 3: Scale

| Week | Action |
|------|--------|
| 9 | Convert provisional patent |
| 10 | Reach $1K MRR |
| 11 | Publish whitepaper on arXiv |
| 12 | Warm intros to a16z Bio, GV |

---

## 6. Specific Opportunities

### 6.1 Google Cloud for Startups

**Program:** cloud.google.com/startup
**Value:** Up to $100K in cloud credits + access to Google engineers
**Why:** Aligns with Google acquisition thesis
**Action:** Apply immediately — free credits for Fly.dev migration

### 6.2 NSF SBIR - Digital Health (H6)

**URL:** nsf.gov/seedfund
**Focus:** "AI in healthcare, personalized medicine, clinical decision support"
**Your Pitch:** "Deterministic governance layer for LLMs in clinical workflows"
**Phase I:** $275K, 6 months

### 6.3 StartX (Stanford)

**Requirement:** Stanford affiliation OR exceptional tech
**Value:** $100K+ network, zero equity
**Pitch:** Rhythm Engine = novel CS contribution

---

## 7. Bottom Line

**You need $25K-$50K to:**

1. Convert provisional patent to utility
2. Fund 3-6 months of runway
3. Get 2-5 paying pilots

**Best Path:**

1. **Now:** Get 1 free pilot in 2 weeks
2. **30 days:** Apply NSF SBIR ($275K non-dilutive)
3. **60 days:** Apply Techstars/accelerator ($120K + network)
4. **90 days:** VC conversations with proof of demand

**The technology is ready. The market is ready. Go get the customers.**
